meanings.definition: Chance or luck as an arbitrary force affecting human affairs.
meanings.sent1: She believed her fortune changed when she found a lucky penny.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to find his fortune by playing the lottery.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a fortune that the rain stopped just before the outdoor wedding.
meanings.sent4: Her fortune seemed to turn when she met a kind stranger who helped her.
meanings.sent5: The fortune of winning the raffle made her day unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A large amount of money or assets.
meanings.sent1: The pirate's treasure chest was filled with a vast fortune in gold coins.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a fortune from her wealthy relative.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a fortune in cash made him feel like a movie star.
meanings.sent4: His hard work paid off, and he amassed a small fortune over the years.
meanings.sent5: The fortune he made from selling his invention allowed him to retire early.

meanings.definition: A person's condition or standing in life determined by material wealth.
meanings.sent1: Despite his humble beginnings, he rose to a position of fortune and influence.
meanings.sent2: In some societies, a person's fortune dictates their social status.
meanings.sent3: She flaunted her fortune with expensive cars and designer clothes.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur's quick rise to fortune surprised many in the industry.
meanings.sent5: His fortune brought him power, but it also brought him many responsibilities.

meanings.definition: Fate or destiny viewed as predetermined and inevitable.
meanings.sent1: She believed it was her fortune to meet her soulmate at the park.
meanings.sent2: Some people see their misfortunes as part of their predetermined fortune.
meanings.sent3: It was his fortune to be born into a loving and supportive family.
meanings.sent4: The fortune of being in the right place at the right time changed his life.
meanings.sent5: His fortune seemed to be written in the stars, guiding him towards success.
